Certainly! One example of a successful campaign by Comic Relief is "Red Nose Day." Red Nose Day is a biennial event that takes place in the United Kingdom and involves a telethon broadcast on the BBC, as well as various fundraising events across the country. The campaign aims to raise money and awareness for people living in poverty in the UK and internationally.

Since its launch in 1988, Red Nose Day has raised over £1.4 billion in funds to help vulnerable people in the UK and across the world. In 2019, the campaign raised more than £63 million, which was distributed to a range of projects supported by Comic Relief. These projects included initiatives to support homeless people, refugees, and people affected by conflict and natural disasters.

One of the notable achievements of Red Nose Day was the provision of immunization to over 17 million children against deadly diseases such as measles, pneumonia, and tetanus, in Africa. The campaign has also helped over 11 million people affected by the Syrian conflict and has supported thousands of people affected by homelessness in the UK.

In addition to raising funds, the campaign also raises awareness and encourages people to take action to help those in need. The success of Red Nose Day demonstrates the impact that Comic Relief's campaigns can have in tackling poverty and improving the lives of individuals and communities.
